p: Introduction: Sepsis is a systemic inflammatory response caused by infection and leading cause of the death across the globe. Severity of infection increase if untreated and lead to more lethal conditions, such as severe sepsis and septic shock. There are several source of infection for development of sepsis; however, half of the cases start from lung and known as pneumonia. On the basis of infection site, pneumonia can be categorised as community acquired pneumonia (CAP) and hospital acquired pneumonia (HAP). To understand the response of body under CAP and HAP, we compare the plasma proteome of sepsis patients.
